medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing dyspnea on exertion refractory to maximal medical therapy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Several months before the operation, the patient reported symptoms of increasing dyspnea on exertion that did not respond to maximal medical therapy. No specific intensity or factors aggravating or relieving symptoms were mentioned.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura, hypertension, hypothyroidism, and osteoarthritis. History of several abdominal and gynecologic procedures with uncomplicated post-operative courses. Denied history of syncopal or presyncopal episodes, atrial fibrillation, strokes, or transient ischemic attacks.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) and sudden cardiac death in several family members.
